alert.note: Alert for Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 5:57PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Cherry County through 645 PM CDT... At 557 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Merritt Reservoir, or 14 miles southwest of Valentine, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Merritt Reservoir, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River and Anderson Bridge State Wildlife Management Area. This includes Highway 97 between mile markers 116 and 136. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
